meanings.definition: Discrimination or prejudice based on physical appearance.
meanings.sent1: The looksisms in the workplace can make some employees feel inferior.
meanings.sent2: She experienced looksisms when she was not chosen for the job because of her appearance.
meanings.sent3: The looksisms in the schoolyard were evident when the popular kids only played with the 'pretty' students.
meanings.sent4: The looksisms in society can be as damaging as any other form of discrimination.
meanings.sent5: The looksisms she faced growing up shaped her self-esteem and confidence.

meanings.definition: The belief that physical attractiveness is the most important quality in a person.
meanings.sent1: His looksisms made him prioritize appearance over personality in relationships.
meanings.sent2: The looksisms in the fashion industry can have a negative impact on self-esteem.
meanings.sent3: She realized her looksisms when she caught herself judging others solely on their looks.
meanings.sent4: The looksisms in the media can create unrealistic beauty standards.
meanings.sent5: Her looksisms blinded her from seeing the true beauty within people.

meanings.definition: The act of judging someone solely based on their looks.
meanings.sent1: Her looksisms led her to make assumptions about people before getting to know them.
meanings.sent2: He faced looksisms when he was overlooked for promotions due to his appearance.
meanings.sent3: The looksisms in the dating world can prevent genuine connections from forming.
meanings.sent4: Looksisms can prevent individuals from showcasing their true talents and abilities.
meanings.sent5: She learned to look beyond looksisms and appreciate people for who they truly are.
